meanings.definition: To dip lightly or quickly into water
meanings.sent1: I saw a bird dap its beak into the pond for a drink.
meanings.sent2: She likes to dap her toes in the pool to test the water temperature.
meanings.sent3: The fish decided to dap its tail in the water for fun.
meanings.sent4: The raindrops dap the surface of the lake, creating ripples.
meanings.sent5: The child learned to dap his fingers in the puddle, making tiny splashes.

meanings.definition: A quick, light blow or pat
meanings.sent1: He felt a gentle dap on his shoulder, signaling his turn.
meanings.sent2: The dap on the door was barely audible but distinct.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a playful dap to the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The dap of the falling leaf on the ground was almost musical.
meanings.sent5: She received a dap on the back as a sign of encouragement.

meanings.definition: A style of greeting or handshake involving a series of slaps and bumps with another person's hand
meanings.sent1: They greeted each other with an elaborate dap, full of energy.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated their win with a dap that echoed through the room.
meanings.sent3: The dap between friends was so enthusiastic that they almost missed their train.
meanings.sent4: The dap between the siblings was a secret code only they understood.
meanings.sent5: The dap at the party was so lively that it became a dance routine.
